param.name: equiweight
param.label: Enforce equal weighting from each analysis?
param.help: Some effort is required to equalize the contribution of the results from each analysis. This is done by setting selecting yes, where the weight of each window is inversely proportional to the number of windows from that analysis.

param.name: mergeWindows_selector
param.label: Additional parameters to pass to mergeWindows?

param.name: sign_selector
param.label: Specify a positive log-FC for each window?

param.name: sign
param.label: Positive log-FC for each window
param.help: Upload as datafame with a column of logical values

param.name: max_width
param.label: Maximum size of merged intervals
param.help: Specification prevents the formation of excessively large clusters when many adjacent regions are present. Any cluster that is wider than the max width is split into multiple subclusters of (roughly) equal size. Specifically, the cluster interval is partitioned into the smallest number of equally-sized subintervals where each subinterval is smaller than max width. Windows are then assigned to each subinterval based on the location of the window midpoints. Suggested values range from 2000 to 10000 bp, but no limits are placed on the maximum size if no value entered.

param.name: ignore_strand
param.label: Ignore the strandedness of regions?
param.help: If no is selected, the entries in regions are split into their separate strands.

param.name: region_selector
param.label: Specify regions of interest for overlapping with windows?

param.name: sign_list_selector
param.label: Specify whether the log-fold change is positive for the corresponding windows?

param.name: sign_list
param.label: A dataframe with rows of logical values specifying whether the log-fold change is positive for the corresponding window
param.help: The values in the rowscorresponds to and is of the same length as the GRanges objects.

tool.help:
First count the number of extended reads overlapping a sliding window at spaced positions across the genome generated by windowCounts using different width values.
Then consolidate windows of different sizes into a common set of clusters. This will merge windows of differing sizes. If no regions of interest for overlapping with windows is specified, windows of all sizes are clustered together, using a tolerance of 100 bp. Otherwise, clusters are defined by overlapping windows of all sizes to region, where each entry of region defines a cluster.
The aim is to consolidate statistics across window sizes using consolidateTests or consolidateOverlaps. This will provide comprehensive detection of DB at a range of spatial resolutions. However, this requires some care to balance the contribution of analyses with different window sizes to the combined p-value. This is achieved by weighting each window and using the weights in downstream functions.
